div.div: θελκτήριον (θέλγω): any means of charming or winning, spell, charm; attributed to the girdle of Aphrodīte, ἔνθα τέ οἱ θελκτήρια πάντα τέτυκτο, Il. 14.215; of songs, θελκτήρια βροτῶν (obj. gen.), Od. 1.337; and of the Trojan Horse, a winsome offering to the gods, Od. 8.509.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
